byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: Taliban commander Mullah Akhtar Mansour receives letter of rebuke over his handling of Afghan insurgency from leaders in militant group's Pakistani headquarters; missive censures Mansour for crackdown on rival commanders and seizing control of opium trade; atypical disclosure reflects growing infighting after death of founder Mullah Omar.
lead_paragraph: A letter by the religious leaders criticized the new insurgent leader for the violent discipline of his commanders, reflecting deep tensions in the hierarchy.

headline.main: Taliban Chief Rebuked by Religious Leaders in Sign of Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Rebuke of Taliban Leader Signals Tension in Hierarchy

snippet: A letter by the religious leaders criticized the new insurgent leader for the violent discipline of his commanders, reflecting deep tensions in the hierarchy.
